attributes.action: Introduce a Restriction on automated checkouts
attributes.additional_details:
Automated checkouts are becoming increasingly prominent in dominant chains.  Chains which have served to displace independent shops and are monopolising our high streets are now introducing automated checkouts.

While these stores will argue that they are not laying off staff as a direct result of automated checkouts, this technology will dramatically alter future employment habits.

Stores such as large supermarket chains, having removed independent stores, now have an ethical obligation to local employment, and the use of automated checkouts should be limited to ensure local jobs are not reduced.

This petition proposes that not more than 25% of all checkouts in a single store should be automated.
